page.title: 16AIR AND WATER TRANSPORT
page.content: {Air Transport In the winter lots of helicopters take suplies to stranded homes in Strathnairn. Some of the animals would die if they did not get straw and hay after the blizzards. Lots of one man army jets from the base at Kinloss near Lossiemouth fly over us and they make a terrible noise.The noise travels behind them. Planes from London and the south of Scotland pass over Strathnairn on their way to Dalcross Airport. { {Water Transport Some fisher men take rowing boats out on the Lochs which are mostly for private fishing. Other people use sailing or motor boats for pleasure. The rivers are too shallow for boats.
